medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr G first developed erectile dysfunction several years ago, with symptoms becoming more noticeable around the time his wife became ill. He noted decreased libido and difficulty attaining an erection. He also experienced slight urinary urgency, but had no difficulty initiating urination. Despite discussing the possible use of sildenafil four months ago, he never tried the medication, expressing concerns about the risks.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension and sleep apnea; previous colonic adenoma found on a screening colonoscopy in 2001. No history of diabetes or cardiovascular disease.
medical_history.family_history: His wife has metastatic breast cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Mr G lives in a suburb of Boston with his wife, works part-time, and noted considerable stress due to a home renovation project.
